Key Match Events: Kawhi Leonard made his season debut for the Los Angeles Clippers in their 131-105 victory over the Atlanta Hawks.
Leonard scored 12 points and collected three rebounds in 19 minutes of play.
Leonard went 3-for-3 from long range during the first half, finishing 3-for-5 from 3-point range overall.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Tyronn Lue confirmed that the team will be intentional with Leonard's playing time, treating it like his preseason and training camp.
Leonard became a full-contact participant for Clippers’ practices starting Dec. 18, fueling speculation about his return.
Post-Match Reflections: Leonard expressed confidence in his return but acknowledged his ongoing day-to-day status due to right knee soreness.
Coach Tyronn Lue emphasized taking it slow with Leonard's playing time.
